website_summaries.verdict: A high-performing, easy-to-use knee scooter from one of the most trusted brands in the industry. Works well for foot, ankle, and lower leg injuries, as well as below the knee amputations.
pros: Offers significant control and stability while steering
Knee rest features 3.5” of contoured padding for added comfort
Locking handbrake secures the scooter while getting on and off and reliable rear drum brakes allow for quick stopping
Handy basket makes it easy to carry your belongings
cons: Wheels can come loose over time and folding mechanism may be difficult to engage

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: This product needs improvements is quality control and tolerances. The scooters head stem bearings are brutal. There is way too much slop in the connection between the frames neck and head stem. The scooter I purchased either has the wrong bearing or quality control is extremely poor. The amount of play in the handlebars is huge and as a result the scooter is a bit unstable. The front axel should be a few inches wider as well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, durable , lightweight, and stable. Super easy assembly !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Buy !! A scooter was recommended by my surgeon. After lots of research I went with the Kneerover. Super easy to assemble ! Lightweight but durable and stable. This has helped me so much ! Oh, get the basket, you won’t regret it !
customer_reviews.author: Steve TwentyOne

customer_reviews.title: Stable only on very smooth surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and fold. This will be fine for you if you will use it only on very smooth surfaces. I found it to be quite unstable on outside surfaces though and frankly was afraid to use it. This is due to the tires. Catch a twig or a pebble or even a line in a concrete sidewalk and you could easily take a tumble. If you are buying this it is because you (or someone you are buying it for) is already hurt. You don't need another fall. Spend the extra money to buy an all terrain version with better tires.
customer_reviews.author: Lin55

customer_reviews.title: Clumsy and with very little turning radius
customer_reviews.text: I broke my fibula and am wearing a large orthopedic boot. Ordered this to use in my NYC apartment and on the city streets. The back wheels to not turn...so navigating tight spaces is very difficult. The turning radius on the front wheels seems to be about 15 degrees...again, very difficult to navigate. Seat pad for knee is very hard...had to strap a pillow on top of it. And this rover has no shock absorbing qualities whatsoever. Used on sidewalks and the street, the ride is bumpy and unstable and painful to use. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Bailey

customer_reviews.title: great for increased mobility
customer_reviews.text: I love my Knee Rover! I broke my heel this summer and my Knee Rover has allowed me to have the mobility I need without the use of crutches. It is solid and easy to maneuver around. It folds to take in a vehicle for travel. It has a basket so I can put my purse in it to go shopping. There is a brake to control the speed when going down declines. I even was able to take it on a pontoon boat so I could enjoy the lake this summer. This is the best piece of equipment that I could have purchased to allow me freedom and access inside and outside. I would give this 10 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Brakes started to fail after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I hate bad reviews, but this is a dangerous problem! I had this scooter for 3 weeks, not even using every day, and the brakes are not holding. Became worse every ride. Please be careful. I will not use again. And cannot sell or giveaway due to defect. If not for that this would be the greatest thing every for a broken ankle. I hope this is a single incident with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kay

customer_reviews.title: What a great product and easy to assemble, great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Well I was very concerned about this purchase because my wife is 65 with a broke ankle and I worried that this might not be stable enough and didn’t want another accident. It took 15 minutes to assemble, wife got on it and she was all smiles as she could now get around with out crutches. As for stability, I was very impressed. The quality seems very good but this is only first day. She is not a strong person and had no issues operating and locking the brake. If your looking for a knee scooter and want quality and easy to use, spend the extra few dollars and buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Knee Scooter
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this scooter is heaven sent. If I didn't have it I would be stuck using crutches for 12 weeks and that would have killed me. It seems once you are older than 40 all of your abilities to use crutches disappears. I would definitely recommend this scooter for anyone that can't use crutches and needs to not walk on their leg.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J.

customer_reviews.title: Throw your crutches away, this device is all you need.
customer_reviews.text: Throw your crutches away! This device is all you need. Before I got this I had already fallen face first while using crutches in the 1st 24 hours after surgery. My only problem is I don’t have 2 of them, 1 upstairs and 1 downstairs, but I guess that’s what you have husbands for right. It was easy to assemble, very light weight but extremely sturdy. It maneuvers well in tight places. I have yet to find a area I can not get into while using it. I do wish it would have come with a bit more instructions on proper height settings, but I did find that on there website.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne A.

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver if you cant handle crutches.
customer_reviews.text: None of these scooters are easy to turn in tight spaces, or easy to manuveur in small spaces. It is like a childs wagon.. if you turn to far it is going to tip so you just need to give yourself more space. Not so easy for a person who has a bum leg to fold It either but here is the deal... it is a life saver if you can’t handle crutches and need to be non weight bearing. The take away is that benefit far outweighs any of the drawbacks. If you need it for more than 6 weeks this is probably cheaper than renting.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer for better Mobility.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t laugh (to much), I named mine Zippy the Wonder Scooter. This scooter was very easy to assemble - took less than 10 minutes- sturdy - great brake - comfy cushion. The basket could be a bit bigger but it holds a small purse and water bottle, or other small items. A bit tougher to push on carpet, but it glides quickly over tile or wood floors. I set my handlebars a little higher than my waist because I was bending to far forward and it hurt my back. Very happy with my purchase. It’s given me greater independence and is much more comfortable and fun than crutches. Yay for Zippy !!!
customer_reviews.author: SDL

customer_reviews.title: This IS the scooter
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this scooter in green after having foot surgery, mostly to prevent my foot from swelling and keep any discomfort to a minimum. BEST PURCHASE EVER. I'm 5' 2" and have the handle set on the 3rd punch, seat on the 2nd punch. The knee cushion is really firm and supportive. I also purchased the Pad Cover for more softness. The basket is sturdy and removable. Spend the $$$ and have some fun with this scooter. Decorate it for the Holidays or go down some not-so-steep hills, the brakes work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Foshea

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Living alone with a broken foot is impossible. This knee coaster gives me the mobility I need to function alone. No I can’t go up or down stairs, but one level is so doable. Rolls very well on hardwood and tile. A little harder to push on carpet but does the job. I can sit on it for sponge bath and easily maneuver for getting to bed, doing personal toiletries, etc. it doesn’t truly fold down so will take some space for storage. It has been a lifesaver for me!
customer_reviews.author: nh

customer_reviews.title: Great little scooter!
customer_reviews.text: Great little scooter, especially for the price. I used it for weeks around the office after breaking my ankle. If I didn't have this item I would have stayed home! I couldn't master crutches and a walker was "ok" for around the house. Also do yourself a favor and make sure you buy the basket with it - I used it so much. Now for a little additional truth - it was way stable inside, outside on uneven pavement/blacktop, I just went slower and watched myself. If you have to be outside a lot, you may want to pay more for the upgraded, thicker tires.
customer_reviews.author: Slicksquirrel

customer_reviews.title: Saved me after multiple foot and ankle fractures
customer_reviews.text: I was Non weight bearing for 2 months. Would not recommend for maneuvering in small areas. But worked very well for in my house. Used it when I went to dr appointments and shopping. Stability is good on wood flooring. Could be better on asphalt and concrete. I now know why they sell a model with more rugged tires. Used by 300 lb woman with no worries about capability to support weight while rolling or for balance when trying get onto it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B

customer_reviews.title: INDOOR FLAT SURFACEUSE ONLY
customer_reviews.text: This product has a short life span as it definitely deteriorated and three weeks of use. The handlebar steering column has significant amount of play and does not handle bumps well. This is not an outdoor scooter and people who don’t have the dexterity or strength to maneuver over bumps should not use it. The slightest jolt causes the steering to jar to left or right and can cause someone to tumble. The cushion does not last long. Only good for indoor use and flat services and short duration.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ampol

customer_reviews.title: Good for smooth flat surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in hopes of being able to move easily about after serious ankle surgery. I'm a tall and heavy individual and someone lighter with lower center of gravity might get a much better use of this scooter. I found unless the surface is smooth, it can be somewhat dangerous. You do have to watch your path. I discovered the parking brake feature does not work and the adjustment suggested by the seller requires metric wrenches (unable to get to my wrenches at the current time.) I do like the basket and have used it around the house as you do need both hands on the steering handle when using.
customer_reviews.author: R. Feagins

customer_reviews.title: It really only works on very smooth surfaces, so ...
customer_reviews.text: It really only works on very smooth surfaces, so I can't use it for commuting, which was a big reason for purchasing it in the first place. It can't handle city sidewalks well at all. The assembly instructions leave something to be desired, and the 800 number that you can call for assistance always rolls into voice mail. Emails are responded to with canned responses, not direct answers to your questions.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Willow

customer_reviews.title: Not for someone who is exactly 5’0 tall otherwise nice scooter
customer_reviews.text: States good for 5’0 and up. I’m 5’0 and it’s too tall - I must wear a shoe with a one inch heel or more. Around house doesn’t go over area rugs very well so be careful. I purchased early before a surgery and missed window of return to go with a small adult/junior scooter. Otherwise, it gets me around the house and basket is a lifesaver. Wish it had dual brakes. I cannot get the brake to set in locked position so that’s a little concerning. I am non weight-bearing for eight weeks and rely on this to get me around the house
customer_reviews.author: stlmom

customer_reviews.title: gives more stability than crutches
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after my daughter fractured her foot. She took her crutches to school for two day and was in so much pain under her arms. She says it is so much easier getting around the big school and no more armpit pain. I felt more confident about her stability while maneuvering around the hallways between classes. She will probably only use it for two weeks but if I go through the doctor my insurance only pays a percentage of a scooter and the doctor charges $400 so this is a much better deal.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: A whole lot better than crutches!
customer_reviews.text: Was miserable with crutches, and ordered the bike, which arrived in a timely fashion. The bike needed some assembly, but for the most part, that was pretty quick. It was a little hard to maneuver in small spaces, but it is what it is. It was hard to adjust the breaks, even though my husband knows how to do such things. There is a button to act as an "emergency brake", but we could still move the bike with that brake on...not a lot, but it shouldn't move at all. All in all, we are glad we purchased the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Very stable and sturdy. Easy to get used after foot surgery even though we are old. Update ---- Now that we have used it for awhile we still like it but if we were buying now we would get larger diameter wheels. These are close to 8 inch diameter. They hang up on door threshholds and pavement cracks requiring my wife to stop and lift the bike up. A friend with considerably larger wheels glides right over. It would make the bike heavier and more expensive but would be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Ebsworth

customer_reviews.title: New KneeRover Steerable Knee Scooter  excellent; open box Scooter was bad, missing parts & damaged.
customer_reviews.text: The KneeRover Steerable Knee Scooter arrived on time, in perfect condition. Set-up was quite easy. Directions, while not stellar, were adequate. Don't waste time on 'Open Box' ; it only saves $15, but is possibly damaged with missing parts. (A week earlier we bought the same scooter as 'Open Box'. Parts missing; unhelpful Warehouse personnel. After foot-dragging by her, we insisted on speaking with Return Supervisor. After much insistence, the Supervisor authorized return and full refund.)
customer_reviews.author: chas

customer_reviews.title: Not the best. Scooter but it works.
customer_reviews.text: It is kinda a pain to fold ,we have a small car so we had to shrink the handle bars down to get it in the car and I was so afraid we were going to lose the bolt that hold the handle bars in place. Also the maneuvering is crazy because if you get in a small bathroom or store or whatever you have to pick up the back of it and move it to get out of the tight spots and that is hard to do with one foot.
customer_reviews.author: April  Leyden

customer_reviews.title: Works well but is noisy
customer_reviews.text: Assembly directions were a little unclear and so it took us a bit longer to assemble than we had hoped. Once we got it togeher we found it made a horrible noise whenever the wheels were turning. We traced the noise to the back wheel that was connected to the brake. We tinkered with the brake to see if we could fix it. The only thing that sort've worked was putting a rubber band around the brake handle and handlebar. This applied a little pressure on the brake but not so much as to make it difficult to use. If we weren't in dire need, we would have returned this for a different model.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to crutches
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cause I broke my foot and could not handle crutches with bad knees. Very sturdy, easy to ride but turning radius is not great for making tight turns. I did buy the extra foam cushion since I have bad knees and it is very tolerable. I don’t think it’s very lightweight and it is hard to figure out how to collapse it for folding. All being said I do love it and it is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Yeah I can go to the Dr., I have wheels! !
customer_reviews.text: Since I have a sprained or something bad leg and knee, I can't kneel down with my bad leg, so I can use good leg and push ever so slowly with bad leg, BUT I like walking ever so slowly behind, in FRONT of the scooter! Give me a place to rest after so many yards, place to sit and use as tricycle, A WHOLE LOT BETTER THAN CRUTCHES!!!!!!! Plus I can put in car and go to see Dr.!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank H. Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Safe and Solid
customer_reviews.text: My wife needed this knee scooter to get around after foot surgery. We had rented one from a medical supply drug store years ago that was flimsy and dangerous, so we decided to purchase rather than take a chance. This item was secure, solid, and easy to maneuver. The cost to own was about the same as our rental fee, so this was a great deal. I hope we don't need to use it again, but it will be folded up and stored just in case.
customer_reviews.author: CleanFreak

customer_reviews.title: Better for indoors - don't get if you need to navigate city sidewalks
customer_reviews.text: This scooter would be fine for inside a large house or office, or in a shopping mall - anywhere with flat surfaces. On the city sidewalks it is unsafe, and threatened to tip over at the slightest bump (hello, twig!) and uneven pavement. The constant jarring made it hard on the knee that rests on the pad, and also quite tiring to maneuver. I returned it for a heavier duty All Terrain KneeRover , which is exactly what I need to confidently navigate the city. It's nearly twice as expensive, but so very worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Frisco kid58

customer_reviews.title: Tight turnaround
customer_reviews.text: This scooter was built of quality materials. It was easy to assemble and maneuvered well on flat wide open spaces. However, maneuverability inside my home with tight corners was miserable. I had to make many back and forth slight turns to get around. Also the locking system for the brake required a lot of strength. I think that would be really tough for a sick person. I wound up returning the scooter due to maneuverability issues and the company was very understanding.
customer_reviews.author: KatieK

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to fold, but works great for my husband to get around. If we needed to do this again, we would pay more for a all terrain knee scooter. Little stones and cracks in the sidewalk will stop this one and falls could happen. I think the one with larger wheels might be more stable. The wheels, after 9 weeks, are wearing down. However, this is sturdy and useful Perfect for in the house. Outside, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!
customer_reviews.text: The knee rover allows mobility when you are in a cast and cannot stand or walk. The handy basket allows you to carry around books, magazines, phones and a bottle of water. Be careful not to fill the basket too full! When you are turning, the weight in the basket could make you off balance. This scooter really gives you the mobility you need while you are in a cast!
customer_reviews.author: Garnett Grad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome-get one with a basket!
customer_reviews.text: Smooth ride. It can be a quick ride, so take it easy speedy. The cushioning in the pad lasted about 10 before it lost it's cushiness. My knee got really sore about that time too because all my weight was on the knee and cushion. The basket is a must on these things. I read complaints about the turn radius, but it's fine. There's a reason for the lack of turn radius..it's so you won't jack-knife and flip. Brake is great. I've had this for almost 1 month and will continue to need it for another 3 weeks. (total 7 weeks) Overall, this was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: doubledecker

customer_reviews.title: This was a Godsend for us!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is not one who wants to be babied. I bought a wheelchair which was never used. We took this scooter through airports and toured cities with it. It folds and fits in the trunk with the basket removed. He loved scooting around and sometimes liked to see how fast he could go. He used it for work too. Obviously, you can't use it on stairs, so we needed to be mindful of noticing where the handicapped ramps were located. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: S Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Don't pay extra for color
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on saturday (im a prime member) these things are usually ordered because you REALLY Need them. In a hurry! But still had to pay an extra $20.00 to get it to in two days. PRIME MEANS 2 DAYS. OTHERWISE.....it seems sturdy. Brakes work well. Rolls easily. It IS NOT A PRETTY GREEN. Reminds me of army green. Flat, bland green. Basket not very secure when moving in and out of vehicle. Constantly putting back on.
customer_reviews.author: MEIZRDRN

customer_reviews.title: Awkward, heavy & tough to transport
customer_reviews.text: I tore my Perineal & Achilles’ tendons & has to keep weight off foot, so I thought this would be easier than crutches. Turned out to be VERY uncomfortable on the knee. I even bought a heavily cushioned pad for it, but it is still uncomfortable to use for any length of time over10 minutes. Awkward to steer, going over any bumpy or uneven surfaces really shake it up & can make you lose control. Using outdoors is difficult, unless on smooth concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie B.

customer_reviews.title: Not for shorter people or those with arthritic knees
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice scooter, and I wish it had worked for me! I tried to make it work by adding additional padding, but that made it even more too high for me than it already was and it still hurt my knees. I'm 5'6" (it said for 5'5" or taller), have arthritis in my knees and weigh more than I should. Also, because of the scooter's length, a fair amount of maneuvering is required to make turns to get through doorways into bedrooms and bathrooms. But on a smooth, straight surface it moves along nicely and is a really kind of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Avid mystery reader

customer_reviews.title: cheaper to buy than rent
customer_reviews.text: Would not have survived at the conference I went to without this. A bit challenging in tight spaces but you get the hang of it. The basket is a must. I also bought the cup holder which has been very helpful. The breaks work great, which was especially helpful going down the entrance to the plane. So many to choose from and I research for days...happy with this one. Helpful hint - get the padded cover so your shin doesn't get bruised after extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Terri - Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend
customer_reviews.text: Scooter works well. I have only used it indoors so far, but have had no issues. A tighter turning radius would be great, but idk if any scooters have that. This was cheaper than renting for the time I need it and if I had to use crutches or a walker, I think I would just give up. I've had 5 major back surgeries and fibromyalgia, so this scooter is a life saver. Oh, my husband assembled it with no trouble, but he's an engineer and very good at these type of things. 😉
customer_reviews.author: DearCara

customer_reviews.title: Good knee scooter
customer_reviews.text: Works a lot better than crutches and easy to assemble! The basket is very convenient since I tend to forget things. I like to put my cell phone, meds, etc. I haven't used it outside my house since it's kind of heavy and I have stairs I need to go down. I noticed the knee rest cushion is getting a little flat (it is still comfortable) but I've had it for a month and I've been using it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turn radius is terrible!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had several surgeries in the past and I had a knee scooter for all of them the same scooter. I decided it was time to retire it so I bought this one the thing I regret the most is the turn radius is terrible it’s almost impossible to to even go down the hallway and make a thru a door. I find myself constantly picking up the front of the scooter to maneuver it the direction I need to go. I’m concerned that I’m going to hurt my back doing this I have to do it so often for this reason and only this reason I question my purchase every other aspect of the scooter has been fine
customer_reviews.author: TKaes

customer_reviews.title: with this amazing scooter allows him to be independent and tool around ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scooter for my husband who is recovering from bunion surgery and what a lifesaver it's been for the both of us! He's in a cast up to his knee and unable to put any weight on his foot; with this amazing scooter allows him to be independent and tool around while I'm at work. I was very simple to assemble, he put it together in about 10 minutes, very well built and the knee pad is very comfortable. The basket is the best feature as he can put all of his supplies, lunch and beverages in it without him having to juggle anything. Highly recommend for anyone recovering from surgery!
customer_reviews.author: Amy J Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not for short people
customer_reviews.text: When buying one of these check the height of the seat. Being 5'1" it was too high and caused me to be off balance when "scooting" resulting in hip and back pain. Also it is pretty heavy so I can't get it into the car by myself. Otherwise there is nothing wrong with it and it folds which is convenient. I am returning and bought one which is lighter and lower to the ground at it's lowest adjustment. Both have baskets which are a must.The one I have now is: Drive Medical Dual Pad Steerable Knee Walker with Basket, Alternative to Crutches Drive Medical
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver for getting around, you do have to take it slow as uneven concrete could cause a fall. It's made my first 3 weeks of no weight on my ankle very smooth. I do recommend the seat they sell for this unit. It rolls great on hard floors, carpet presents a little tougher issue but your able to maneuver. I would buy this for any upcoming surgeries and would never do without one compared to crutches. My only change would have been to get an all terrain to be able to maneuver on grass.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: I really felt like I need to go very slow as the really ...
customer_reviews.text: This KneeRover is unstable . I really felt like I need to go very slow as the really thin wheels would catch on any thing that is in the way. Like small rocks, pieces of wood or cracks in sidewalk. It did throw me over handle bars once. What is needed are wider , bigger wheels. If I would have know how unstable, would not have purchased. Look for scooter with larger thicker wheels.
customer_reviews.author: soquellarry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent choice to help my husband get around after foot surgery. He said the crutches hurt his underarms and were clumsy, a wheelchair was too awkward requiring large amounts of space to maneuver in. The scooter was easy for him to manipulate and he was very quickly zipping around. Just a note though, watch out for rocks and other obstacles. Well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Rookie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his scooter because it makes him much more mobile after his left foot surgery. Last year he had right foot surgery and had to use a wheelchair and walker which he hated! The Kneerover is sound and easy to assemble. Takes a little effort making turns, but it's for safety reasons. The basket is awesome because it frees up his hands.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Brown

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and helpful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister after she had ankle surgery. She used it to get around the house instead of crutches. Nice basket to help carry things. She got a lot of use from it in the six weeks she used it. Really good quality. My kids who are 20 lbs and 28 lbs kept climbing in the basket for rides and it withstood that torture just fine.
customer_reviews.author: ylime85

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend getting the better off road model
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend getting the better off road model. This one has skate board type wheels so you feel every bump in the ground. Also when you hit anything in your path it jerks the wheel making it easy to fall. The off road version has bicycle type wheels which would solve this issue. Also the seat would keep moving left or right and needed to be constantly adjusted. No matter how tight you would make it it would still move. Also basket easily comes loose.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got this product. It was my best friend after Achilles surgery. My only complaint was the turning radius but you can't expect it to be much better due to the required length for your leg. I did find it more comfortable to raise the handles up so I wasn't bent over. Overall it was great. I got to use it to walk my dog...even on the park trail. It was great!
customer_reviews.author: CARRIE FOSTER

customer_reviews.title: Great For Injuries-Just Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this scooter when I fractured my ankle and it has been a blessing in helping me get around my house. The good news: it is very light and if you get stuck in a corner, you simply pick it up and point it in the desired direction. However, I find because it is so light, it tips easily if you turn the handle bar too far to the right or left. I have already taken 2 spills in my house. You need to be very cautious when using it and go slowly.....but this definitely beats using crutches. The basket is extremely helpful as it is very difficult to carry anything if you are on crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara K. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Great scooter while your injured limb heals!
customer_reviews.text: This little scooter has been great for my wife's sanity! She can get out and around without the pain of the crutches after 4 weeks! Still another 4 before the Dr. says she can put weight on a broken ankle. She can kneel and scoot or sit when that becomes tiring and ride along like a seated scooter! The wheels are large enough that travel through a parking lot or store has not been an issue. Take it easy over the door entries and sidewalk to parking lot transitions but other than that secure and good!
customer_reviews.author: Will in NC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent aid for surgery recovery
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best purchase I made as part of surgery recovery aids. Excellent stability, easy glide, good hand brake, handy basket, comfortable knee pad, and light enough to load in my back seat without help. The rental scooter I used before this was so unstable I overturned twice. Not this one. Was rock solid. The turning radius was not great but I think that is for safety reasons. Otherwise the chances for a spill are greater. I’ve had people stop me and ask where I purchased, and some have taken photos of the name so they can order. I give this product 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: TKAUBAL

customer_reviews.title: Good knee scooter
customer_reviews.text: My son had two foot surgeries over the course of a year. This was perfect for him to get around, especially at school. While awkward to fold down the handle, it wasn't too difficult. It fit nicely in the back of my car (hatchback). The basket is removable, which is nice. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Existential Crisis

customer_reviews.title: Really happy I bought this and it came really really fast with the free shipping
customer_reviews.text: It's very upright. So, it's not meant for racing. I'm 6'5" and 280lbs and I never felt unstable or like I had to hunch over too much. The brakes catch and aren't really a smooth stop. The brake lock doesn't really work either. The construction is high quality and strong. The basket is worth it for the upgraded model. Glad I bought this when I had ankle surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Careful with the brakes
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am pleased with this scooter. The basket falls off very easily on small bumps so I would suggest getting it tied on.The brakes stopped working after 2 weeks. When you press on the break while your riding it works but when you want to put the brakes on while you get off it doesn’t work. For the price it’s “ok” but now I need to figure out how to fix the brakes.
customer_reviews.author: zory

customer_reviews.title: FREEDOM!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after foot surgery and will be non-weight bearing for several weeks. I was given crutches but those are a pain in the butt!!! This scooter gave me the freedom to move around and carry stuff at the same time. I love the basket! I go everywhere on this thing. I do recommend getting a soft cover or a padded cover for the knee area. I don't have particularly boney knees, but the soft cover really made a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Steph H.

customer_reviews.title: It’s an incredible value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I am recovering from a broken tibia. It has been a tremendous help! I was in a splint with a non weight bearing restriction the first three weeks, and I am currently still in a boot cast. The knee scooter was much easier to get around with than crutches, and with the boot cast it allows me to take it off and still get around without the cast. It’s light weight, easy to steer, and the knee rest is comfortable. It’s a steal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Olson

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I'm a young seventy and in pretty good shape, but I couldn't see using crutches to move around my home, let alone at work. I cannot tell you how convenient the scooter has been in my recovery from ankle surgery. With a bit of ingenuity I could dress, go to the bathroom and get in and out of bed much easier than if I was using crutches. Pay the xtra for the basket, it saves trips.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Is easier than crutches but it isn't very steady. ...
customer_reviews.text: Is easier than crutches but it isn't very steady. I fell over sideways 3 days after my tendon repair and landed with all my weight on the surgical foot that was supposed to be nonweightbearing. You have to pay close attention to the ground when you are using it because if you come across any unevenness, it jerks to the side and tries to throw you off. I have also almost fallen off of it twice due to this happening. Overall, it serves its purpose and enabled me to go back to work. You just absolutely have to pay attention when using it so you don't fall off of it.
customer_reviews.author: mel8851

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of junk! This piece of crap has broken twice, once the break and the other the handle bars. Run Run if you can. Company email comes back because have "problems with it". They send a new part, but failed to say you must take it to a bike shop for repair due to special tools. Really? Can walk or get around without it. Had to rent one for $45 after buyer this junk! Shameful for someone who needs it.
customer_reviews.author: Bette Curtis

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE product for after foot surgery.
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine life without it right now, one day post foot surgery. This little guys will be my second leg for 2 weeks. Crutches SUCK and are dangerous for an overweight, middle-aged chick, you do not want to be dependent on THEM. I debated paying a little extra for the brakes and basket, but realize now...those features are not luxuries, but rather necessities. I'm snockered on Vicodin right now, so if parts of this don't make sense, that's why. Just know I am very, very happy with the scooter. I'm also sure the grandkids are going to have a blast on it next week, at Christmas ;)
customer_reviews.author: karen miller

customer_reviews.title: The knee scooter has been great to get around the house and the basket is ...
customer_reviews.text: God send. I live alone and broke my ankle. I tried crutches and I'm just too out of shape to use them constantly. The knee scooter has been great to get around the house and the basket is great for carrying things around. It was heavier duty than I thought it would be, but a little larger than expect too, can be a bit challenging to maneuver, but still better than crutches or walker for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cushion for knee
customer_reviews.text: Maneuvers well, glad I got the basket, and non-marking wheels, one of the main reasons I chose this model is the thickness and comfort of the knee cushion. It is great, hasn't hurt my knee, very cushioned. I haven't had to fold the roller so I couldn't comment. I'm very happy with my purchase and feel like I made a good decision about purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Better than crutches!
customer_reviews.text: Way better than my crutches! I had Achilles rupture surgery two months ago and this has been a life saver. I’ve been using it so much that it’s getting a little worn out but I guess it’s to be expected. The main company that sells these start at $550 So this price is way more reasonable. I recommend this product if you can’t walk and need crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Stable and easy to get used to
customer_reviews.text: I ruptured a tendon in my ankle, had surgery and a cast on my leg - This is so much better than crutches - My balance is not great so crutches stink. You can really scoot on this but the brakes are very good - But the brakes do require some adjustment, easy to do but you do need to adjust them. Having a basket is a great help - you always need to carry something.- with 4 wheels it is stable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H. Preston

customer_reviews.title: A great knee scooter.
customer_reviews.text: I just had foot surgery. The knee scooter used in the hospital was no comparison to the Knee Rover! Some notable differences. This scotter has wide front wheels which greatly improves it's stability. A good breaking system, one lever that Locks both rear wheels as opposed to tire stops using two tire drags for breaks. Excellent on carpet. The construction is heavy metal as well as most all the fasteners. Even the basket is metal! Very well constructed. Stability is the key to successfully using a knee scooter. Buy the pad, it's well worth the money. I'm very satisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: dsviking1938

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: After 4 skin cancer surgeries I decided to get a scooter. Love the size of the basket. Light weight scooter and easy to manuever. The knee pad is hard at first but does get softer. I tried the add on knee pad, but found that it didn't allow for the knee to remain in the middle as there was no indentation to hold the knee in the center.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ausloos

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to get around in!
customer_reviews.text: This is great to get around in with a foot injury. Way better than crutches!! Very substantial and sturdy and steers and glides smoothly and easily. If you are small and petite this was on the heavy side and not foldable so, although do-able, a bit hard to get into car - especially with a foot injury. With scooter I was able to go places like shopping that would not have been possible with crutches! I also used in my home. So happy I had this to get around on! Easy to put together - very important.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brake lock does not hold!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this scooter for my wife to use during the 6 weeks of her recovery from a broken ankle. Upon receipt we assembled it [directions were poor] only to find that the brake lock would not hold. No adjustment seemed to help. Using the scooter without a brake lock would be very dangerous. Interestingly enough we happened to meet another senior couple at the surgeon's office with the very same scooter. When we asked about their experience with it, they immediately complained that the brake lock did not work and that he had tried every means of adjusting it for his wife without success. They were not happy with the scooter either.
customer_reviews.author: Streamside

customer_reviews.title: I like the product as the quality appears very good for ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the product as the quality appears very good for the price and serves the purpose intended. My biggest complaint is that the instructions provided for assembly are poorly written. I had a great deal of difficulty getting it together - as did three others. When I contacted the company they told me there was a website demonstrating assembly. That should have been the first line of the instructions. I could not find that fact in their instructions. I may have accidentally damaged the spring on the steering mechanism in my many...many attempts to assemble the product.
customer_reviews.author: peter van helden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for her needs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife after ankle surgery, it is much easier for her to get around on this instead of crutches. I don't worry about her slipping on the crutches on wet ground. Perfect fit for her needs. Assembly was straight forward and easy. My only complaint is the brake cable is way too long, going to re-route it and see if that helps. Overall I would recommend one of these for anyone with a lower leg injury.
customer_reviews.author: RD5

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to assemble and to use.  I am very glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: The hard wheels make it uncomfortable to use on sidewalks with the many gaps in them. Twigs are a HUGE nuisance. I now use it only on the street. The hard tires do work well in the house but not so outside. I wish I had purchased one with softer tires.
customer_reviews.author: Cleanwater

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to maneuver but the handle bar was wobbly. Overall, the scooter was a great purchase and assisted in my ability to be independent after knee surgery. Couldn’t tighten the handle bar but it was stable enough to use throughout the day. Added to review - just noticed that a part was installed upside down by the vendor. This is why the handle bar is wobbly. Keeping the scooter because I’ve had surgery and need the item.
customer_reviews.author: N. Baker

customer_reviews.title: We could rent one for $100 a month or buy this one,  we chose wisely.
customer_reviews.text: It adds a layer of freedom that you don't realize you are missing until you try to live with crutches.... it is light enough and small enough for you to lift and put in the car. Makes it so easy to get around the house, gives you the ability to leave the house...very important... is even fun to use. Shipped quick, easy to assemble. Well built, quality materials were used, has several safety features built in. Ease of use... smooth surfaces recommended, carpet is a little more difficult, shouldn't use on uneven or rocky surfaces. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gran

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery on my left foot that kept me from walking for 7 weeks. After about 3 weeks I broke down and got this Knee Walker to get around at home, still using the crutches outside of the house. I quickly adjusted to the Knee Walker and was so happy with my purchase. Crutches are exhausting and finding an out of the way place to stand them (where they won't fall over) is a pain. My only complaint besides the slightly confusing directions is the turn radius. It was difficult getting around the house, but I made do with a lot of 3-point turns.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shupik

customer_reviews.title: Claim your life back!
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to using crutches! Got this after a Lisfranc dislocation surgery. Have been able to use to get around the house independently. Used on shopping trips to the mall for holiday shopping. I’ve even taken it around the block to walk my dog! I got a lot of people stopping to ask about it for their family members. The only downside is how uncomfortable the knee pad can get after a few hours!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's stable.
customer_reviews.text: It's designed for safety not maneuverability. I guess I'd rather have safety, but a different design might afford both. The brake lock is very helpful. I tried crutches and a walker. The Kneerover is better by far. Haven't been outside or folded it so I can't speak to that. I think the price is fair and recommend this Kneerover.
customer_reviews.author: 2milehill

customer_reviews.title: Meets the Need
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scooter due to having bunion surgery and it has worked out well. It doesn’t roll real easily on thicker carpeting but is fine on hard floors and would probably be fine on thinner carpet. The basket is very handy and the hand brake locks so the scooter is stable when I’m working at my kitchen counter or the likes. I use extra caution outdoors as small rocks, debri, cracks or bumps on sidewalks affect the steering. It might roll more smoothly if the front wheels were larger than the rear wheels. Overall, I am satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait to make sure the durability was good before reviewing. This works great. My dad has been using this for almost 6 months now on and off. He’s had 2 foot surgeries and needed a knee scooter to get around. This is just as good as the one we rented from the medical supply store a few years ago and bought it for the price of a 2 month rental.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Norton

customer_reviews.title: Great scooter
customer_reviews.text: It is certainly better than crutches as long as you don't have stairs to worry about. Easily fit in the trunk of our car. Only concern would be if you wanted to use it in the grass it becomes unstable. We bought it for less than the copay to rent one via insurance.
customer_reviews.author: A-A-Ron

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Comfortable, Nice-Looking, Quiet, Light
customer_reviews.text: Great knee scooter! Very sturdy, comfortable and easy to use. Light enough to pick up and move easily if needed. Much nicer than crutches, and it's about as wide as a typical person so I can easily go through doorways that would be tight with my crutches! Extremely pleased with the product and with the seller, it arrived quickly and well-packaged.
customer_reviews.author: G Hiles

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scooter!
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a fall and ankle fracture. I was unable to manage crutches. This was definitely worth the price and a very high quality knee scooter. It was easy to steer and gave me the freedom to be more independent than I would have been with crutches. I like the wire basket as it is very durable and easily removable. This product was very sturdy and construction is similar to a bicycle. I highly recommend this product and feel even though I needed it for only a short time, it was well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: MollyL

customer_reviews.title: Good with Reservations...
customer_reviews.text: Very stable. Unfortunately, there is wide turning range, compared to one that I rented several years ago (Mgr: Drive). Necessary for my husband to pick up front end and maneuver into direction he’s going to turn some corners. Otherwise, he is happy with this for the four months that he will need it for non-load bearing period after breaking his ankle/fibula. Note: get the padded faux sheep skin cover! Knee rest needs some added padding!
customer_reviews.author: Sarahjune52

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Love my scooter! Makes my life with a broken leg so much more mobile! Crutches hurt and you can’t carry anything plus I fell on the crutches and in bad weather crutches are not fun. This will get you to where you need to be faster & safer. Plus has a brake. I recommend getting a basket for the front for carrying things.
customer_reviews.author: Katt

customer_reviews.title: Must have for broken ankle or leg
customer_reviews.text: If you have broken your ankle or lower leg and are thinking about buying this, just buy it. I broke my ankle skiing at the end of January and live alone in a small city apartment. This scooter was a lifesaver for getting around the house and basically carrying anything I needed which would be impossible on crutches. We have brick sidewalks in this neighborhood and I found it wasn't stable on the raised bricks. But no issues in the house. Best money I ever spent. Get a pad/cover too - I bought the Vive Knee Walker Pad cover/Faux sheepskin and it made a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Always set your hand break!!!
customer_reviews.text: Saved my life. Adults on crustches are scary! Saved me a lot of frustration. I took a header a few times because I forgot to set the hand break. I loved my scooter so much I named him Brad. I don’t need Brad anymore but now I lend him out to people who do. Not very easy to fold down for compact travel. We would just lay him on his side in the back of the car.
customer_reviews.author: brett

customer_reviews.title: Great scooter to get around when you can’t put weight on one foot.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best way I have been getting around my apartment since I had surgery on my foot. It rolls on the floor so easily and the basket allows me to get my mail without worrying about holding it. Plus it was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Millicent Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This scooter is a life (ankle) saver! The setup out of the box was super easy- no tools needed, easy to understand instructions with pictures.. maybe took 5-10 minutes. Pro’s: Easy and quick setup Useful basket Adjustable heights Feels sturdy Con’s: Turning radius isn’t too wide but it’s OK The seat cushion is somewhat uncomfortable for my knee
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Allows mobility and independence!
customer_reviews.text: The KneeRover is stable and is a pretty smooth ride! When you have to stay off one of your legs, this little buggy gives you the ability to get around outside, go shopping, go for "walks", etc... I have a small house, so it wasn't that convenient indoors, but wherever you have space, it works. The KneeRover is well-made, durable and makes an unfortunate situation somewhat fun and easier to manage.
customer_reviews.author: Bird Watcher

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect solution to my problem of using crutches
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect solution to my problem of using crutches. Its much nicer in person and works perfect. I am going to let my father in law use it as a scooter when I am finished with it. 5 stars do not hesitate to buy this scooter. It was so easy to put together an all parts were with it. I also purchased the recommended sherpa pad to help with heat/cold issues. Thank you for a wonderful product and quick shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Telly Peters

customer_reviews.title: Better engineered product than most at this price point
customer_reviews.text: This knee rover cart has a proper brake system compared to my previous knee cart purchased from another company. These knee rover carts have small versions of auto brakes on them. The other company had metal tabs rubbing on the tires! Not good.{The first cart was replaced because a plastic wheel hub failed and a wheel fell off! } If you look at the various different carts you will see that the knee rover wheel hub assemblies are larger than most. The overall build quality is also better ie. fit, finish and stronger welds . Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: david dahlin

customer_reviews.title: The basket is very useful.
customer_reviews.text: The scooter arrived with an errant metal piece stuck in the bubble wrap. After screwing the handlebar piece endlessly with no luck I figured out this piece must have fallen off the end of the handlebar center rod! Finally the handlebars were firmly attached! The scooter is heavier than I had hoped making it awkward to get in and out of the car (when you are doing this on one leg). It has also, after just a week, developed a squeak in a front wheel so I need to WD40 it. Other than these issues it is maneuverable and quite zippy! The basket is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L Giles

customer_reviews.title: The small tires make the scooter dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this scooter now for three weeks. I would not purchase this product because it is unstable on sidewalks. The tires on this product are way too small to handle cracks in the sidewalk and I’ve been thrown off the scooter or flipped over twice now. When the small tires encounter a crack or rivets in the sidewalk they basically become very unstable and the entire handlebar turns to the side. Mind you, I am in very good shape and it’s still a challenge to maneuver around the city with the scooter. I would look for one of the scooters that has larger or off-road tires.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: A necessary purchase for NWB (non-weight bearing) status.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. The brake failed after 2 days and my husband went on KneeRover website and followed instructions for tightening. Has been fine since. The handle bar post wobbles and we haven't yet found a solution. The knee padding is sufficient and the basket very helpful. I don't think i can use outside as the wheels are some type of plastic; although excellent for indoors.
customer_reviews.author: marilee donovan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Scooter
customer_reviews.text: Really need to be careful when going from one floor level to a lower one. My husband ended up falling off the scooter on the patio, and breaking his patella. Had to return the scooter , because he could no longer use it. Customer service was great though.
customer_reviews.author: tom i

customer_reviews.title: FREEDOM
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product a 10 I would !!!! This has given me my life back!!! Freedom!!!! My daughter put it together for me and was quite simple! I broke my ankle and so much easier than crutches and a lot more safe!! There was a part missing and I called kneerover and they were SO THOUGHTFUL and OVERNIGHTED the piece to me . I will keep this forever just in case and if anyone goes through something similar I will purchase one for them!!! Yes I recommend this product without a doubt!!!
customer_reviews.author: sally2683

customer_reviews.title: Helpful product but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: Mixed reviews as I’m still adapting to it. Difficult to maneuver through tight areas and backing up. Have only used inside and think I will need to buy an all terrain version for outdoor use as these wheels are pretty small and from end needs to be lifted slightly to go over door thresholds. Was not the easiest to assembly but video on site helped.
customer_reviews.author: karen B

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous tipping
customer_reviews.text: This scooter is dangerous. Tips easily, navigating other than forward is almost impossible. Pushing back or forward to get out of spaces you will either hit the back of your ankle or run into you foot. With all of this said, I would definitely investigate other scooters and hope the reviews are more accurate about the ease of tipping and navigation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for helping me get around the house when my ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for helping me get around the house when my foot was broken (Hardwood Floors). Doesn't do sharp turns though, needs to be picked up to turn corners, for me that wasn't a problem for others it might. Also becomes wobble if it hits even the smallest bump on the ground, not great outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre D Washington

product_meta.title: KneeRover Steerable Knee Scooter Knee Walker Crutches Alternative in Green
product_meta.description:
KNEEROVER STEERABLE KNEE SCOOTER KNEE WALKER 

The Most Trusted Mobility Solution from the # 1 Knee Walker Brand

The Steerable Knee Scooter is a proven, trusted, and durable mobility aid that delivers one of the best knee walker values in the industry. Ideal for for individuals recovering from a broken foot, broken ankle, broken leg, foot surgery, ankle surgery or other lower leg injuries or medical conditions like ulcers.

Sturdy dual bar frame, an adjustable locking handbrake and rear disc brake deliver excellent stability and control.

Ideal for indoor and outdoor use, the knee walker features smooth 7.5" diameter non-marking rubber wheels with shock-absorbing sealed windows. 

Compatible with both the right and left legs, the Steerable Knee Scooter kneeling walker offers a 3" thick contoured knee platform and ergonomic rubber hand grips for complete comfort. 

The Steerable Knee Scooter knee walker is lightweight and portable thanks to its simple folding mechanism that utilizes an easy to use thumb-release lever. Additionally, these knee walkers are equipped with a free detachable storage basket and feature tool-free assembly & setup.

Specifications:
Color:Green 
Product Weight: 22.3 lbs
Weight Capacity: 300 lbs
Overall Length: 31" 
Handlebar Height Range: 29.5" to 38" 
Overall Height w/ handlebar folded and seat removed: 18" 
Knee Support Height Range: 17.5" - 22" 
Knee pad: 7" width x 12.5" length 
Front Axle Width: 16" 
Rear Drum Brakes 
Wire Basket: 9" x 11" x 8" 


NEED MORE ACCESSORIES OR PARTS FOR YOUR KNEE WALKER? When considering an accessory or part for your knee walker scooter, check out the full line of KneeRover accessories available on Amazon - including Knee Walker Backpacks, Sheepette and Memory Foam knee pad covers, cup holder, LED head light, baskets.
feature_bullets: Ideal for individuals recovering from injury or surgery to the foot, ankle or lower leg as well as below the knee amputees. The Steerable Knee Scooter is one of the most proven and trusted knee walkers in the industry and an excellent crutch alternative. NOW AVAILABLE IN GREEN OR PINK.
Excellent stability and control when maneuvering - these steerable knee walkers offer an adjustable locking handbrake and rear disc brake.

Ideal for indoor and outdoor use, the Steerable Knee Scooter kneeling walker features four 7.5 inch non-marking rubber wheels, a comfortable 3.0" thick contoured knee platform that is left or right-leg compatible, and a free basket.
The Steerable Knee Scooter also features handlebars with a quick folding mechanism for easy transport and storage.
Fully adjustable handlebars and knee platform, this lightweight yet sturdy knee walker offers a robust 300 lb weight capacity and is recommended for individuals with heights 5' - 6'6

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
